alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 1:36PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wyoming, including the following county, Carbon. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to rapidly melting snowpack and additional rainfall from showers and storms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated flooding due to snowmelt. The Little Snake River at Savery crested just under minor flood stage at 9.98 feet this morning. A similar or slightly higher crest is likely on Friday morning. Minor flooding is expected to persist through the end of the week. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Snake River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Carbon County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
